page.title: 05Farming in SW.Cheshire(1).
page.content: 75% of the farmland is grassland used mainly for dairying,but there are also some beef cattle.Farms are large eg.Hatton Farm 212 acres(for 140 dairy cows & 100 young stock),Hatton House Farm 200 acres(100 beef cattle), Cold- harbour Farm 150 acres (with an autumn calving dairy herd as the winter milk price to farmers is better),with part of the extremely large Grosvenor Estate occupying a third of the area. Hattonheath Farm,now cultivated,until 1984 reared the "Grosvenor Holstein" herd,(see page 6).Holstein cattle are larger & produce more milk (on average about 7000 litres per year) than Freisians like the "Handley herd of British Freisians" on Grange Farm. Half the Cheshire dairy cattle are pure Holstein or crossed with them.All the milk is taken 10 miles by road tanker to Marchweil creamery in Clwyd.
